events.title: Access to RSS feeds is rejected
events.summary: Your large amount of concurrent requests for RSS data causes problems. Use the API or contact ops@reliefweb.int

events.title: Greetings from Mexico City's iconic boulevard, where a dog on a bike steals the show
events.summary: Every week, more than 100,000 people ride bikes, skates and rollerblades past some of the best-known parts of Mexico's capital. And sometimes their dogs join them too.

events.title: Suspect in Canada school shooting was an 18-year-old with prior mental health calls
events.summary: Police said the suspect in the school shooting in remote British Columbia, Jesse Van Rootselaar, was found dead and had a history of mental health contact with police, and that the suspect's mother and stepbrother were also found dead.

events.title: The U.S. claims China is conducting secret nuclear tests. Here's what that means
events.summary: The allegations were leveled by U.S. officials late last week. Arms control experts worry that norms against nuclear testing are unraveling.

events.title: 'I feel hope': Venezuelan opposition leader talks about being released from detention
events.summary: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Jesús Armas, a prominent Venezuelan opposition leader, who was – until recently – held at one of Latin America's most notorious detention centers.

events.title: New Zealand mosque shooter asks appeals court to throw out his guilty plea
events.summary: The man serving a life sentence for New Zealand's deadliest mass shooting asked an appeals court to throw out his guilty plea.

events.title: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to meet with Trump at the White House
events.summary: President Trump and Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will meet Wednesday. The meeting comes at a critical moment for negotiations between the U.S. and Iran.

events.title: Foundation for Defense of Democracies CEO on why he thinks the US should strike Iran
events.summary: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Mark Dubowitz of the Foundation for Defense of Democracies, who says the U.S. should strike Iran.

events.title: Father of U.S.-based Hong Kong activist convicted under national security law
events.summary: The father of a U.S.-based activist wanted by Hong Kong authorities was convicted of attempting to deal with an absconder's financial assets on Wednesday, in the first court case of its kind brought under a homegrown national security law.

events.title: Former NATO chief on Europe and U.S. relations
events.summary: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Anders Fogh Rasmussen, former prime minister of Denmark and former head of NATO, ahead of the Munich Security Conference.

events.title: Mothers in the U.S. use crowdfunding tactics to help families in war-torn Gaza
events.summary: After connecting through social media, an informal network of moms started crowdfunding to help families in Gaza afford food and shelter.

events.title: Madagascar: Cyclone kills dozens, causes widespread damage
events.summary: Authorities said at least 31 people have been killed with several still missing. Its estimated some 250,000 people have been impacted by Tropical Cyclone Gezani.

events.title: 'Dawson's Creek' star James Van Der Beek dies at 48
events.summary: The actor's wife said "He met his final days with courage, faith and grace." Van Der Beek had been battling cancer.

events.title: Germany's Deutsche Bahn halts humorous publicity campaign
events.summary: German Rail was once famed for its punctuality. But chronic delays, frequent cancellations, poor in-train services and rising ticket prices have dogged its reputation. And a humorous PR campaign has not helped.

events.title: EU ups drone cooperation amid hybrid threats
events.summary: The EU is increasing its efforts in drone security following multiple drone incursions into EU airspace in 2025. The new action plan aims to improve cooperation, but Europe’s drone security network remains patchy.

events.title: US Attorney General Pam Bondi grilled over Epstein files
events.summary: Bondi gave testimony to lawmakers over the Justice Department's handling of the Jeffrey Epstein files among other matters.

events.title: Is Heraskevych's Olympic 'helmet of remembrance' political?
events.summary: Olympic organizers have banned Ukrainian skeleton racer Vladyslav Heraskevych from wearing his helmet, which features images of athletes killed in the war on Ukraine, during competition.

events.title: Germany: Tesla charges trade union member in IG Metall fight
events.summary: Tesla's German factory in Grünheide is pressing charges against an external trade union member. The company said he was caught recording a confidential meeting without permission; the IG Metall union called this a lie.

events.title: NATO begins 'Arctic Sentry' mission to secure region
events.summary: Through the "Arctic Sentry" mission, NATO is bolstering its military presence in the Arctic in an effort to de-escalate the conflict over Greenland.

events.title: US blames Mexican cartel drones for El Paso airspace closure
events.summary: The Trump administration claimed drones belonging to Mexican drug cartels had "breached US airspace," without providing further information. Mexico's president denied knowledge of any such incident.

events.title: Fact check: Trump vs. Obama on ICE deaths and deportation
events.summary: Do US Presidents Obama and Trump truly have similar records regarding immigration? DW breaks down ICE deaths, deportations, and policy differences.

events.title: Indian teens roll their eyes at talk of a social media ban
events.summary: India has joined the growing list of countries considering a social media ban for children under 16. Young Indians are not happy and are already plotting workarounds.

events.title: Greenland's Olympic siblings keen to help protect homeland
events.summary: Sondre and Ukaleq Slettemark usually make up Greenland's biathlon team, despite a lack of facilities. But they are competing for Denmark at the Winter Olympics and, unlike Donald Trump, they want it to stay that way.

events.title: Death Penalty on the decline in Southeast Asia
events.summary: Countries across Southeast Asia are moving away from the use of capital punishment. But Singapore remains an outlier.

events.title: Politics meets escapist thrills at the 2026 Berlinale
events.summary: An Afghan feature opens the Berlin International Film Festival, while stars including Pamela Anderson, Ethan Hawke and John Turturro are expected on the red carpet.

events.title: Berlinale 2026 honors Michelle Yeoh, icon of cinema
events.summary: Recognized with the Honorary Golden Bear in Berlin, the Malaysian actor became the first Asian woman to receive an Oscar, in 2023 for her role in "Everything Everywhere All at Once."

events.title: Olympics T-shirt marking 1936 Berlin Games raises eyebrows
events.summary: T-shirts on the Olympics online store commemorating past venues include one for the 1936 Games in Berlin. Nazi Germany hosted both the Winter and Summer Olympics that year, as it was starting to ramp up its repression.

events.title: How close is Nigeria to meeting its clean cooking target?
events.summary: Nigeria has pledged to achieve universal access to clean cooking by 2030. But over 70% of its population still relies on unsafe charcoal and firewood for cooking, exposing mostly women and children to illnesses.

events.title: Thailand: Gunman opens fire at school
events.summary: Three people have reportedly been injured in a shooting incident at a Thai school.

events.title: Under-pressure Iran marks Islamic Revolution anniversary
events.summary: A commemoration in Iran of the 1979 Islamic Revolution is taking place amid internal and external strains. A bloody crackdown on protests last month has deeply corroded the faith of many in the country's leadership.

events.title: EU needs capital market reform, simpler regulations, von der Leyen says
events.summary: The European Union needs to "tear down the barriers" if it wants to become a truly global economic giant, the European Commission chief said.

events.title: Samer Tawk: From intensive care to Winter Olympic return
events.summary: In 2018, Samer Tawk became the first athlete to represent Lebanon in cross-country skiing at the Winter Olympics. A year later, he was lying in a hospital bed wondering if he would ever walk again.

events.title: German government pushes Syrians to return to their homeland
events.summary: Nearly 6,000 Syrians in Germany have applied for voluntary return to Syria in 2025. But with security concerns lingering and reconstruction slow, Syria remains too unstable for most refugees to consider going back.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Zelenskyy says ceasefire must precede vote
events.summary: Ukraine's president pushed back after a media report suggesting an election could be announced later this month. Meanwhile, the European Parliament approved a €90 billion loan for Ukraine. DW has more.

events.title: Lufthansa pilots, crew to strike on Thursday
events.summary: Lufthansa passengers should expect disruption and possible cancellations. A pilots' trade union has called a 24-hour strike amid a dispute over pension payments.

events.title: Germany logs rising rate of crimes against journalists
events.summary: A total of 818 crimes against journalists or media were reported to Germany's investigative federal police force between April 2024 and November 2025. Just over 10% of them were violent in nature.

events.title: Epstein files: Germany scrutinizes newly released documents
events.summary: The scandal surrounding US sex offender Jeffrey Epstein is rocking European countries. In Germany, journalists are combing through the files, and politicians are pushing for investigations.

events.title: Ukraine's Olympic skater has dad and country front of mind
events.summary: Russia's invasion of Ukraine has torn Kyrylo Marsak from his family, but the figure skater has found a particular way to keep his father in mind. The presence of a Russian athete in his event is a source of disquiet.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Europe to set its demands for Russia in peace talks
events.summary: The EU's Kaja Kallas signals a tougher EU line on Russia in potential peace negotiations. Meanwhile, the Kremlin says it is ready for dialogue with French President Emmanuel Macron. Follow DW for more.

events.title: The German Olympic ski jump winner with a fear of heights
events.summary: German ski jumper Philipp Raimund hasn't won a single World Cup event. That's just part of what makes his Olympic gold medal performance so incredible.

events.title: Italy: Rai sports staff to strike over Olympic opening farce
events.summary: RaiSport's director gave himself the announcer's job for the Winter Olympics opening ceremony and then proceeded to botch it. Staff have announced a strike in protest to begin once the Games are finished.

events.title: Is Netflix making us stupid?
events.summary: Netflix is increasingly designing films and series for distracted, second-screen viewers. DW's Scott Roxborough asks what it means for storytelling, visual language and the future of cinema as an art form.

events.title: IOC bars Ukrainian skeleton racer from wearing memorial helmet at Olympics
events.summary: Ukraine's bid to let skeleton racer Vladyslav Heraskevych use a helmet honoring athletes killed in the war with Russia has been rejected by the International Olympic Committee.

events.title: Slovakia's embattled LGBTQ+ community hopes for change
events.summary: New restrictive legislation in Slovakia comes despite rising public acceptance of same-sex couples, making the situation for the LGBTQ+ community complex and contradictory.

events.title: Macron warns Europe faces political and economic crisis
events.summary: The French president urged EU leaders to confront competition from the US and China and back a "Made in Europe" strategy.

events.title: Germany news: Berlin releases report on hidden violence
events.summary: Germany has released its first report on violence that goes unreported, both behind closed doors and in public. Meanwhile, a series of so-called "warning strikes" is being staged by public sector unions. DW has more.

events.title: Germany: Queer referee attacked after viral proposal
events.summary: Referee Pascal Kaiser went viral after proposing to his boyfriend during a Bundesliga game. Then, the 27-year-old was attacked, though the motive is still unclear.

events.title: Corruption watchdog reports increase in global graft
events.summary: Once seen as anti-graft strongholds, the US, UK, Canada and Sweden are slipping into decline due to a lack of political leadership, Transparency International's Corruption Perception Index has revealed.

events.title: US, Armenia sign nuclear deal during Vance visit
events.summary: During a visit by Vice President JD Vance, the US and Armenia agreed to cooperate in the civil nuclear sector. Vance will also travel to Azerbaijan, hoping to finalize a peace deal.

events.title: MSC braces for more of Trump's 'wrecking-ball politics'
events.summary: Chairman Wolfgang Ischinger tells DW the 2026 Munich Security Conference comes when "obviously, trust has been damaged" by President Trump. But he also says US calls for a more "self-reliant" Europe are fair and overdue.

events.title: UK: Keir Starmer clings on, party ally calls on him to quit
events.summary: The Scottish Labour leader Anas Sarwar has called on Starmer to quit. But the PM says he has no intention of stepping down, even as a second top aide in as many days falls on his sword.

events.title: Germany's gas reserves face crucial energy supply test
events.summary: The country's stockpiles have dropped to about 30% amid a spell of severe cold. Will supplies hold up?

events.title: The economy's secret lifeline? Nature
events.summary: New global research exposes the business–nature link we can’t afford to ignore — plus the playbook for fixing it.

events.title: Sweden to raise hurdles to gaining citizenship
events.summary: Starting in June, Sweden will require that people have lived in the country for 8 years, earn a modest income and pass a test to gain citizenship. Successive governments have tightened migration rules since 2016.

events.title: Germany's neoliberal FDP: No chance for a comeback?
events.summary: The neoliberal Free Democratic Party played a decisive role in shaping politics in Germany. After a wipeout in the last federal election, the party is fighting for survival ahead of important state elections.

events.title: Germany news: Carnival season set to generate €2 billion
events.summary: Economists predict that an unusually short carnival season will still deliver a significant economic boost. Meanwhile, the trial resumes of a mother accused of hiding her daughter away for seven years. DW has the latest.

events.title: Ukraine updates: Child killed in Russian drone strike
events.summary: A mother and child were among the casualties of a Russian strike in Ukraine's Kharkiv region. Meanwhile, a Ukrainian man has been indicted in Germany for his alleged involvement in parcel bomb attacks. DW has more.

events.title: Spain: Rail strike begins as drivers protest safety failures
events.summary: Two deadly accidents, including one of the worst in Europe, have drawn attention to maintenance issues in the Spanish railway system.

events.title: Portugal: Socialist Seguro wins big in presidential election
events.summary: Veteran center-left politician Antonio Jose Seguro has won 66% of the vote, seeing off a challenge from the far-right.

events.title: Super Bowl 2026: Seattle Seahawks beat New England Patriots
events.summary: The Seattle Seahawks have defeated the New England Patriots in the NFL's showpiece event, with Puerto Rican singer Bad Bunny making history by performing the halftime show in Spanish.

events.title: Albania's judicial reform 10 years on: Hope without justice
events.summary: In 2016, Albania launched a reform program aimed at strengthening its judiciary and making it a pillar in the fight against corruption. The murder of a judge last October has reignited the debate about this reform.

events.title: Memorial for Swiss bar blaze victims catches fire
events.summary: A makeshift memorial for the 41 people killed on News Years Eve at the resort inferno in Crans-Montana caught fire. The memorial site was a place for mourners to place candles, messages and plush toys.

events.title: UK PM aide quits over pick of Epstein-linked US envoy
events.summary: Keir Starmer's top aide Morgan McSweeney has quit amid fallout over the appointment of Britain's former US ambassador. Criticism has mounted as new details emerged of the appointee's links to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Germany's Aicher wins Olympic ski silver as Vonn crashes
events.summary: Germany has earned its first medal of the Winter Games as Emma Aicher finished second in a tight downhill ski race. The event was disrupted after US skier Lindsey Vonn was airlifted away following a severe fall.

events.title: Fake Berlin Wall fragments on sale as souvenirs?
events.summary: It's been nearly 40 years since the fall of the Berlin Wall but you can still buy pieces of it in the German capital as souvenirs. Are they the real deal?

events.title: Why scientists warn of privately funded geoengineering
events.summary: As the climate crisis intensifies, interest in solar engineering is increasing, including among private companies and investors. But the technique is controversial and lacks regulation.

events.title: How the Epstein-Barr virus triggers MS in some people
events.summary: Multiple sclerosis is also caused by a virus carried by almost all humans. A new study provides an explanation as to why only certain people develop the disease. This also opens up the possibility of a treatment.

events.title: Germans increasingly concerned over social inequality
events.summary: Chancellor Friedrich Merz and his conservatives have seen a dip in the polls. This follows weeks of debates over the latest controversial proposals to restructure Germany's welfare state.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony — as it happened
events.summary: The 2026 Winter Olympics opening ceremony is finally here. DW followed the official opening to the 25th edition of the games live in Milan.

events.title: German train conductor's death highlights rise in violence
events.summary: Following a fatal attack on a railway employee, a debate has erupted in Germany about how such incidents can be prevented.

events.title: Women's Bundesliga dispute shows no sign of ending
events.summary: The future of women’s football in Germany remains in limbo, with the country’s top league and its association (DFB) wrestling for control. Germany's top clubs are refusing to work with the DFB, at least for now.

events.title: China grows while Europe slows in South American EV market
events.summary: China's electric carmakers are rapidly expanding across South America as Europe hesitates with trade liberalization. From Brazil to Argentina, a high-stakes battle is unfolding for the region's future auto market.

events.title: Cycle syncing exercise could optimize results for women
events.summary: Women in gyms hear it all the time: lift heavy in some weeks, go lighter in others, depending on your menstrual cycle — because your hormones affect your strength. But is it backed by science?

events.title: Berlin hospitals threatened by spate of attacks
events.summary: Hospitals in Germany's capital are reporting an increasing number of suspicious incidents, including cyberattacks, drone flights and arson. Experts warn that healthcare facilities are easy targets.

events.title: Russia expels German diplomat in tit-for-tat espionage row
events.summary: Russia has declared a military attache at the German Embassy in Moscow persona non grata. It called the move a response to Germany expelling a diplomat and accusing them of espionage, a charge the Kremlin rejects.

events.title: The fight for American football in Europe
events.summary: After the fall of the European League of Football, two rival organizations have emerged to fill the gap. Can they succeed where others, including the NFL, failed?

events.title: Trump to be exposed at Cologne Carnival's Rose Monday parade
events.summary: Donald Trump, Friedrich Merz and Emmanuel Macron are all targets of satirical floats at this year's Rose Monday Parade in Cologne. But Vladimir Putin will be spared — and there is a reason for that.

events.title: How US Project Vault challenges China's rare-earth dominance
events.summary: Donald Trump's Project Vault seeks to secure US access to rare earth minerals vital for advanced tech and clean energy. The EU wants a minerals alliance with Washington, but can they really shift China's outsized lead?

events.title: Winter Olympics begin quietly with curling
events.summary: The mixed doubles curling event kicked off the Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics two days before the official opening of the Games.

events.title: Court in Hungary declares German anti-fascist Maja T. guilty
events.summary: Maja T., a nonbinary anti-fascist activist from Germany, has been sentenced to eight years in prison in Budapest. The trial has been controversial and has political implications.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics: What you need to know
events.summary: This Friday, the 25th Winter Olympics will open in Milan and Cortina d'Ampezzo. How big will the Games be? Will Russia be allowed to participate in the competitions — and what about security and doping?

events.title: World Cancer Day: Smoking, infections and alcohol cause 4 in 10 preventable cancer cases
events.summary: A new WHO study suggests that over 7 million cases of cancer in 2022 were preventable. Nearly 40% of all the cases that year were linked to modifiable risk factors — behavioral and environmental factors we can change.

events.title: Tiny dinosaur fossil could provide evolutionary clues: study
events.summary: Scientists have said fossils of a small newly discovered dinosaur found in Spain could change ideas on the evolution of ornithopods.

events.title: Tackling forever chemicals could save money and our health
events.summary: Critics say a new UK plan to tackle forever chemicals does not match proposed measures in the EU. As European governments try to deal with the growing PFAS pollution, cleaning it up could cost up to €1.7 trillion.

events.title: India's oil shake-up: Can Venezuela really replace Russia?
events.summary: Donald Trump says India has agreed to replace Russian oil with US supplies — and maybe even Venezuelan. DW asks whether the Latin American producer can realistically meet New Delhi's needs.

events.title: Germany and the Gulf region: Energy and arms deals
events.summary: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz is visiting three Gulf states within just 72 hours. He is pursuing new "strategic partnerships" — as Germany's friendship with the United States is becoming increasingly fragile.

events.title: Uhlaender low on Olympic options after CAS appeal fails
events.summary: Katie Uhlaender says she was unfairly denied the chance to reach her sixth Winter Olympics by rivals Canada. The top sports court has now blocked the US skeleton athlete's latest effort to compete.

events.title: FIFA boss Infantino wants Russia to return to football
events.summary: In a surprise statement, the head of world football has said he believes it is time for Russia to return to the pitch.

events.title: Indian trade deal provides opportunity for German carmakers
events.summary: Up until now, German cars have barely penetrated the Indian market despite success elsewhere. Could the new EU-India trade deal be a game changer for the struggling sector?

events.title: Why gold and silver prices suddenly collapsed
events.summary: After hitting record highs last week, the prices of gold and silver have suddenly reversed course. DW looks at how a euphoric rally flipped into a sharp, confidence-shaking rout.

events.title: How a heckled Canadian became Germany's Olympic hockey coach
events.summary: Harold Kreis is set to head to his first Olympic Games as coach of the German men's ice hockey team. Now a legend of the game in his adopted homeland, he wasn't welcomed by all when he first arrived from Canada.

events.title: Vienna swaps parking for green space
events.summary: Conscious of reaching climate goals and strapped for space, some cities are reconsidering how much they dedicate to parking. Austria's capital, Vienna, is streets ahead.

events.title: Trump's Greenland 'piece of ice' remark echoes history
events.summary: Donald Trump's description of Greenland echoes a colonial pattern in which powerful states have dismissed sparsely populated land, ignoring Indigenous ties.

events.title: Germany news: Nationwide strikes hit public transport
events.summary: Many buses, trams and underground trains across the country will not be running amid a strike by a large union. Foreign Minister Wadephul is visiting Singapore. Read more in DW's running coverage of German news.

events.title: Handball: Germany lose to Denmark in Euro final
events.summary: Germany fell at the final hurdle at the European Men's Handball Championship, losing to co-hosts and favorites Denmark in the final. Two German players made the tournament all-star team.

events.title: Rita Süssmuth: The high-profile feminist reformer dies aged 88
events.summary: She dared to break taboos, advocated for women's rights and took part in a failed attempt to oust Chancellor Helmut Kohl as chairman of the CDU. Former President of the German Bundestag Rita Süssmuth has died aged 88.

events.title: Germany: Afghanistan's consulates pose threat to refugees
events.summary: Afghanistan's consulates in Germany are being taken over by Taliban officials, putting Afghan people at the mercy of the regime they fled.

events.title: The hidden money behind deep-sea mining
events.summary: A DW investigation traces the hidden financial web behind deep-sea mining — an industry scientists say remains poorly understood, yet capable of causing irreversible harm to oceans worldwide.

events.title: An undying trend: How vampires like those in 'Sinners' hold a mirror to society
events.summary: As the horror movie "Sinners" stands poised to sweep the Oscars, we take a look at how and why the vampire genre has long captivated audiences — from folklore to film. Is this trend truly immortal?

events.title: Germany's AfD bonds with Austrian far-right extremists
events.summary: Officials from the far-right Alternative for Germany (AfD) party have been openly rubbing shoulders with Austrian right-wing extremist Martin Sellner. This, despite reservations over his Identitarian Movement.

events.title: Canadian actress Catherine O'Hara dies at 71
events.summary: Catherine O'Hara was famous for starring roles in the series "Schitt's Creek" and the "Home Alone" movies. She got her start with the Second City Toronto comedy troupe in the 1970s before her career in Hollywood.

events.title: EU asylum policy: What changes for refugees in Germany?
events.summary: The German government is about to implement the EU's Common European Asylum System (CEAS) to limit irregular migration and speed up asylum procedures.

events.title: 2026 Winter Olympics: Fun events, but what about the bill?
events.summary: Preparations for the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan and Cortina have been far from perfect. Should the Olympics hosting model be changed?

events.title: Trial against German Carnival satirist Tilly underway in Russia
events.summary: Jacques Tilly's Carnival floats mocking Vladimir Putin have landed him before a Moscow court. As the trial drags on, the Dusseldorf-based satirist has denounced the charges as an assault on freedom of expression.

events.title: Silver: Why the price of 'poor man's gold' has hit a record
events.summary: The price of silver has just reached an all-time high of more than $120 per ounce. Although gold has eclipsed the white metal as a store of value, DW explores why silver is regaining global relevance.

events.title: Germany's Bundeswehr goes on military spending spree
events.summary: Germany is spending more on weapons and military equipment than ever before. For the first time, this also includes combat drones.

events.title: Anti-woke Germans in Russia used as propaganda for Putin
events.summary: Media in Moscow are selling a narrative of mass Western migration to Russia, especially from Germany. Numbers contradict the Kremlin's claims.

events.title: Trump tariffs, dollar's dip a double-hit to eurozone exports
events.summary: The euro has reached its highest level against the US dollar since 2021. That has consequences for eurozone companies and consumers, but few think that the European Central Bank should intervene yet.

events.title: Senegal and Morocco fined and banned after AFCON final chaos
events.summary: Africa's governing football body has issued more than $1 million in fines after the chaotic scenes at the end of the AFCON final. In addition, a number of players and Senegal's coach face bans.

events.title: Why fans are obsessed with 'Bridgerton'
events.summary: Opulent romance, a diverse cast and plotlines that meld fairytales with a modern zeitgeist: "Bridgerton" has redefined the period-piece genre.

events.title: Heating with air conditioning saves on cost and cuts CO2
events.summary: From Japan to China and the US to Scandinavia, heating with air conditioning has long been standard practice. But now warming homes with AC is catching on in other parts of the world.

events.title: Tesla profit slumps amid lower EV sales, AI spending surge
events.summary: With increased competition and heavy attention on the antics of the company's CEO, Tesla's core electric vehicle business has faltered in the past year.

events.title: German development policy: Partners in the Global South
events.summary: The Federal Minister for Economic Cooperation and Development is focusing on solidarity and partnership in turbulent geopolitical times. Alabali Radovan's trip to Sierra Leone in West Africa illustrates what this means.

events.title: Arctic scientists 'feel pretty uncomfortable' on Greenland
events.summary: Science in the Arctic — and Greenland — is on the frontline of pressing challenges facing humanity, like climate change and genetics. Some researchers worry international collaboration is at risk.

events.title: CDU, Merz target 'lifestyle part-time' work in Germany
events.summary: A proposal from the economic wing of Germany’s CDU to place tighter restrictions on part-time contracts has come under heavy scrutiny. Chancellor Merz has repeatedly criticized the German work ethic in the past year.

events.title: Amazon cuts more corporate jobs in post-pandemic downsize
events.summary: Amazon told employees that it was cutting 16,000 corporate jobs, completing a downsizing move that began last year. The online retail giant had recruited during a COVID pandemic spike in demand.

events.title: Environmental crises add to Iran's mounting troubles
events.summary: Widespread discontent in Iran has sent millions of protesters into the streets. Poor environmental planning embodies one of the government's most existential vulnerabilities.

events.title: How Germany's skilled worker gap exposes migration hurdles
events.summary: Germany is facing a massive shortage of skilled workers, from nurses to IT specialists. The country needs hundreds of thousands of professionals, but bureaucracy and political hurdles are slowing recruitment abroad.

events.title: What 'banana republic' means — and why its history matters
events.summary: From plantations to political rhetoric, the term's evolution shows how a violent past can fade into metaphor, sometimes obscuring its true history.

events.title: FIFA ex-President Blatter backs call to boycott World Cup
events.summary: With the US due to co-host the football World Cup this summer, former FIFA President Sepp Blatter said a former colleague was "right" to advise supporters to "stay home" and watch on TV amid an immigration crackdown.

events.title: Protests in Iran: Ali Karimi leads sports' call for support
events.summary: Former Iran and Bayern Munich footballer Ali Karimi has signed an open letter, asking FIFA to act. He is not the only athlete to be vocal.

events.title: Plastic emissions could double health damage by 2040
events.summary: Plastic pollution could double its harm to human health in the coming decades if current production trends continue, according to a new study that links rising risks directly to the manufacture of new plastics.

events.title: IOC rejects extra Winter Olympics spot for skeleton's Uhlaender
events.summary: IOC President Kirsty Coventry had been asked to intervene after Katie Uhlaender was the victim of alleged competition manipulation, causing her to miss out on February's Winter Olympics.

events.title: German FA boss says World Cup boycott would be 'misguided'
events.summary: At the first DFL meeting of 2026, German FA boss Bernd Neuendorf spoke for the first time about a World Cup boycott.

events.title: Holocaust survivor Leon Weintraub: "We were dehumanized"
events.summary: The 100-year-old vividly recalls the hunger, death camps and cruelty of the guards. Thus, he tirelessly works to ensure that the Holocaust is never forgotten.

events.title: Paris Agreement 10 years on: More wins than you may realize
events.summary: Major emitter the US has officially left the Paris Agreement and global emissions keep rising a decade on from the deal. Yet renewables' growth shows climate action can work. Here's what's been done and what's missing.

events.title: Australian Open tennis encounters extreme heat
events.summary: Tournament organizers have instituted their extreme heat protocols amid blistering temperatures in the region.

events.title: Ye aka Kanye West apologizes for antisemitic remarks
events.summary: The artist previously known as Kanye West blamed his behavior on bipolar disorder, saying he "lost touch with reality."

events.title: Gold breaks $5,000: What's fueling the price rally and where will it end?
events.summary: Gold continues to hit record highs, having already had a bumper run in 2025. Geopolitical and economic uncertainty are the key factors, while doubts over the US dollar are also attracting new investors.

events.title: EU pushes for deals as Trump's tariffs upset global trade
events.summary: Fear over Trump's tariff walls and the aggressive tone coming from the White House is pushing the European Union to focus on getting other trade agreements done. Despite all efforts, the EU sometimes gets in its own way.

events.title: Germany: Business index starts year with 'little momentum'
events.summary: Germany's Ifo business barometer was stagnant in January, bucking predictions of a slight improvement. A dip in confidence in the service sector put the brakes on improved sentiments in other areas.

events.title: US–EU economic ties show why neither side can decouple
events.summary: Despite a pause in tariff escalation, US–EU trade remains volatile under Donald Trump. From deficits and energy to services and the dollar, the trans-Atlantic relationship reveals deep ties — and clear vulnerabilities.

events.title: Germany weighs boon and bane of China's industrial expansion
events.summary: From cheap exports to cutting-edge tech: A Chinese battery giant's secretive factory in Germany shows how "Made in China" and "Made in Germany" are colliding — and where they can benefit from each other.

events.title: 'Sweet Caroline' singer Neil Diamond turns 85
events.summary: He was a pop icon in the 1970s. Today, one of his songs is experiencing a viral resurgence. From soccer stadiums to TikTok, Neil Diamond's "Sweet Caroline" hasn't stopped playing.

events.title: Trump, Zelenskyy, Carney dominate Davos 2026: As it happened
events.summary: The World Economic Forum has come to an end after a tense but ultimately anti-climactic week at Davos, with the US, Ukrainian and Canadian leaders attracting the most attention. Read DW's wrap of the summit.

events.title: Can China rely on domestic oil after Iran, Venezuela shocks?
events.summary: Donald Trump's moves against two key suppliers have revived debate over China’s fragile oil balance. With domestic output flat and oil fields aging, how much capacity — if any — exists to raise production?

events.title: 'Sinners' breaks records at 2026 Oscar nominations
events.summary: The film by Ryan Coogler earned 16 nods for the 98th Academy Awards, which will be presented on March 15. A new Oscar category was also introduced for the first time in 25 years.

events.title: From Inuit to Vikings to Trump: The history of Greenland
events.summary: After being inhabited only by Indigenous peoples for centuries, the Arctic island saw the Vikings in the 10th century and the Danes in 1721, and it attracted US interest back in 1867.

events.title: UN backs boost in nature-saving business
events.summary: Global financing is heavily skewed to industries that harm rather than preserve nature, according to a new report that calls for an urgent scale-up of nature-positive spending.

events.title: Halabja Massacre: Survivors still haunted by chemical weapons strike
events.summary: Kurdish Iraqis who survived the 1988 chemical weapons attack on Halabja and nearby communities have lasting trauma, a new report finds, highlighting the need for long-term support.

events.title: How bringing back a humble algae to Arctic waters makes all the difference
events.summary: For decades, researchers in northern Norway had tried to bring back vital kelp forests after overfishing damaged marine ecosystems. Now a simple solution is proving successful.

events.title: Like potatoes? Berlin is giving away 4 million kilos
events.summary: As an initiative redistributes a bumper surplus of spuds, here's a look at the Germans' great love affair with the potato.

events.title: Meet Veronika, the clever cow with tools to scratch herself
events.summary: A cow in Austria has been observed using tools ― the first time such behavior has been recorded in cattle. Have we underestimated the gentle bovines all this time?

events.title: 'Sentimental Value' sweeps European Film Awards. Next step, Oscars?
events.summary: Joachim Trier's drama won the top accolades, adding to the buzz ahead of the Oscar awards. Iran was also in the spotlight, with director Jafar Panahi decrying the government's brutal crackdown on protest.

events.title: 8 fun facts about Dolly Parton for her 80th birthday
events.summary: Dolly Parton is one of the world's most successful artists. Now 80, she has an eventful life to look back over. Here are some important and extraordinary facts about the country music icon.

events.title: How European cinema is stealing Hollywood's spotlight
events.summary: As Hollywood doubles down on sequels, the contenders for the European Film Awards feature bold, political works that are challenging audiences and creating buzz far beyond the continent.

events.title: 2026 stargazing: Eclipses, meteor showers and supermoons
events.summary: 2026 will leave stargazers spoiled for sights in the sky, with four eclipse events, multiple meteor showers and several supermoons.

events.title: Livestream: 4 award-winning filmmakers discuss risk-taking cinema
events.summary: DW co-hosts a talk with European Film Award and Oscar nominees Jafar Panahi, Oliver Laxe, Mascha Schilinski and Joachim Trier. Watch it live here.

events.title: 'Charlie Hebdo' cartoon on Swiss fire tragedy sparks outrage
events.summary: A cartoon by the French satirical weekly portraying the deadly fire in Crans-Montana as the "comedy of the year" provokes disgust.

events.title: International Space Station crew to make emergency return to Earth
events.summary: A medical emergency will force four astronauts aboard the International Space Station to return to Earth prematurely.

events.title: Australians are changing their response to wildfires
events.summary: DW's Stuart Braun had a dangerously near miss during Australia's 2009 "Black Saturday" inferno. As this month's fires burned near his rural home, he wasn't taking any chances.

events.title: France’s Cizeron, Fournier Beaudry win ice dance gold at 2026 Olympics
events.summary: French figure skaters Guillaume Cizeron and Laurence Fournier Beaudry won Olympic gold in ice dance on Wednesday, capping a remarkable rise after pairing up just one year ago. The duo topped reigning world champions Madison Chock and Evan Bates of the United States following the free dance final.

events.title: Macron calls Musk ‘over-subsidised,’ pushes Europe to support domestic industry
events.summary: French President Emmanuel Macron on Wednesday pointed to government backing for Elon Musk’s Starlink as evidence of the need for stronger public investment in European industry, drawing a rebuke from the billionaire after calling him “oversubsidised.” Speaking in Antwerp, Macron urged a “Buy European” strategy financed partly through joint EU borrowing.

events.title: US, Israel 'need each other: They may not like or trust one another but relationship functional'
events.summary: Angela Diffley is pleased to welcome Aaron David Miller, Senior Fellow at the Carnegie Endowment for International Peace in Washington. As a veteran Middle East negotiator under Republican and Democratic administrations, Mr. Miller argues that power, perception, and pressure shape outcomes more than goodwill or ideology. Today, Netanyahu's influence is diminishing, and Trump is cornered by his own rhetoric. The US-Israel dynamic is transactional: The relationship may be functional, but it’s fragile.

events.title: Star of 'Dawson's Creek' James Van Der Beek dies at 48
events.summary: US actor James Van Der Beek, best known for his role in the television series “Dawson’s Creek,” died on Wednesday at age 48 following a battle with colorectal cancer, according to a statement posted on his Instagram page. The married father of six revealed his diagnosis in 2024.

events.title: 'If the Cuban government were to collapse, that would be a security threat to the United States'
events.summary: For Spotlight, François Picard is pleased to welcome Emily Morris, live from Havana, Honorary Senior Research Associate at University College London's Institute of the Americas. The fuel embargo has shifted from an abstract policy dispute into something felt in the grain of everyday life. This is not simply “shortage,” but a sequence of events: curtailed events, warnings of deeper power cuts, and above all a transport squeeze that limits mobility, work, and institutional routines like universities moving remotely.

events.title: Bangladesh vote 'a canary in a coalmine for developments in the Global South', expert says
events.summary: Millions of young Bangladeshis will vote for the first time on Thursday in a landmark election to determine the country's leadership following a 2024 student-led uprising that ended former prime minister Sheikh Hasina's autocratic rule. FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney speaks with Dr Chietigj Bajpaee, Senior Research Fellow for South Asia in the Asia-Pacific Programme at Chatham House.

events.title: South Africa and China sign trade deal amid tariff row with the US
events.summary: The Supreme Court in Ghana has ordered the government to reveal the terms of a controversial deportation deal with the US, with rights groups calling the agreement both unclear and immoral. In South Africa, while tensions with the US over tariffs persist, trade relations with China are improving, and exporters are preparing to seize new opportunities in the Chinese market. Meanwhile, in Kenya, the family of General Kiambati wa Njora, the last leader of the Mau Mau movement, is pushing for a national funeral to honor his legacy in the fight for independence.

events.title: Trump ‘insisted’ that US talks with Iran will continue as Netanyahu pushes for their expansion
events.summary: US President Donald Trump on Wednesday said he had “insisted” in a meeting with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that Washington’s resumed talks with Iran over its nuclear programme will continue, but that no “definitive” agreement had been reached. Netanyahu wants to expand the negotiations to include Tehran’s ballistic missile programme.

events.title: French court to rule on July 7 in Marine Le Pen graft appeal trial
events.summary: A Paris appeals court said Wednesday it will rule on July 7 in a fraud case against far-right leader Marine Le Pen, in what is expected to be a pivotal moment for French politics. A lower court last year handed the veteran 57-year-old politician a five-year ban from public office over a fake jobs scam at the European Parliament, dashing her presidential ambitions. FRANCE 24's Olivia Bizot reports.

events.title: Canada police say 18-year-old carried out mass shooting
events.summary: Police on Wednesday identified the suspect in a school shooting in Canada as an 18-year-old who had prior mental health calls to her home and who was found dead following the attack that killed eight people in a remote part of British Columbia. FRANCE 24's Christopher Guly reports from Ottawa.

events.title: What we know about the Canadian school shooter
events.summary: Canadian police on Wednesday identified the suspect behind the deadly school shooting in British Columbia as an 18-year-old transgender woman who had a history of mental health issues. The suspect took her own life at the scene of the crime and is thought to have acted alone.

events.title: 'Netanyahu concerned that Trump wants to make a deal with Iran', expert says
events.summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu stressed to US President Donald Trump that his country's security was his priority in Washington's nuclear talks with Iran, Netanyahu's office said in a statement after the two leaders met at the White House. FRANCE 24's Mark Owen speaks with Dr H.A. Hellyer, Senior Fellow in Geopolitics at the Royal United Services Institute in London.

events.title: Ukraine war: Why is a teenager accused of burying his father 'eight times'?
events.summary: Multiple social media users - many of them pro-Russian accounts - shared a photo montage of a teenage boy carrying portraits at multiple funerals, falsely claiming he'd buried "eight fathers" and that it was proof of Ukrainian 'wartime staging' to rack up sympathy from Western media. In reality, the photos have been spliced together without context, as the teen is a volunteer at funerals in his village for slain soldiers, a role he considers his 'duty'.  Vedika Bahl explains in Truth or Fake.

events.title: Syrian Kurdish fighter's selfie video leads to allegations of massacre
events.summary: A video posted online on January 22 shows a Kurdish fighter posing selfie-style in front of 21 lifeless bodies following the evacuation of a prison in Kobane, Syria. While the Syrian Democratic Forces said the footage is authentic, they maintain the bodies were those of armed combatants – a claim contradicted by our Observer, who was released from the same prison.

events.title: Democratic lawmakers accuse US attorney general of Epstein file 'cover-up'
events.summary: US Attorney General Pam Bondi on Wednesday was accused of engaging in a "cover-up" of the Jeffrey Epstein files and turning the Department of Justice into an "instrument of revenge" for Donald Trump. Bondi, testifying before the House Judiciary Committee, defended the DOJ's handling of the records about the convicted sex offender at a fiery hearing attended by several Epstein victims. FRANCE 24's International Affairs Editor Kethevane Gorjestani explains.

events.title: Walk for Peace: Buddhist monks complete journey from Texas to Washington DC
events.summary: A group of Buddhist monks, a day after completing a 108-day Walk for Peace from Texas to Washington, walked to Capitol Hill on Wednesday before heading to the Lincoln Memorial to conclude their journey. The 19 monks and their dog, Aloka, walked 2,300 miles (3,700 kilometers) across several Southern states — sometimes in frigid conditions — drawing large crowds in churchyards, city halls and town squares. FRANCE 24's Emerald Maxwell reports.

events.title: Epstein-proof? US Justice Department so far spares Trump
events.summary: Here in Europe, the heads have started to roll. As journalists and prosecutors continue to speed read their way through the more than three million documents dumped a week ago Friday in the Epstein Files, the revelations have already led to resignations, sackings and criminal probes in Norway, France, the UK and beyond. British prime minister Keir Starmer’s hanging by a thread and he never even met Epstein.

events.title: Ukraine will not hold elections until a ceasefire is in place, Zelensky says
events.summary: Presidential elections in Ukraine will only happen once a ceasefire has been reached with Russia and Kyiv has received the security guarantees it needs, President Volodymyr Zelensky said Wednesday, rejecting a report suggesting he was considering calling Ukrainians to the ballots within the next three months.

events.title: REPLAY: US lawmakers grill attorney general Bondi over Epstein file release
events.summary: Congressional Democrats accused US Attorney General Pam Bondi on Wednesday of engaging in a "cover-up" of the Jeffrey Epstein files and turning the Justice Department into a weapon of retribution for President Donald Trump during a fiery hearing before the House Judiciary Committee.

events.title: Israel expanding 'de facto permanent apartheid' to carry out total Palestinian 'takeover'
events.summary: Eve Irvine is pleased to welcomes Dr Yair Wallach, Senior Lecturer and Department Head of Israeli Studies at SOAS. As a historian of modern Palestine and Israel, he's witnessed decades of diplomatic frameworks collapse into something far more ominous. What we are witnessing now is an accelerated unraveling of what was once called the two-state solution. The Oslo Accords have faded into the distance amid the institutional hollowing of Palestinian authority, the rise of settler violence, and the de facto annexation of the West Bank. Is Israeli intent a complete takeover of the Palestinian territories?

events.title: 'Well-functioning democracy': Does Norway look closely enough at 'what goes on behind closed doors'?
events.summary: For Spotlight, François Picard welcomes Carl Henrik Knutsen, Professor of Political Science at the University of Oslo. For many years, he has studied the fragility and resilience of democratic institutions. The shockwaves caused by the Epstein files have struck a nerve in Norway. One of the Nordic countries regarded as a model of transparency and democratic virtue,

events.title: People expect shootings in the US, but not Canada
events.summary: There was something about the way the premier of British Columbia, David Eby, struggled to his words in front of the cameras that said a lot about how Canadians view the school shooting in a small town called Tumbler Ridge.

events.title: The royals have seen what they're up against with Epstein scandal - despite hopes William's Saudi trip would shift attention
events.summary: We had temporarily lost Prince William. Rushing through the narrow streets of the Old Town of Al Ula in Saudi Arabia, our guides eventually helped us catch up with him.

events.title: Olympian's ex-girlfriend responds after his cheating confession following medal win
events.summary: The ex-girlfriend of Norwegian biathlete Sturla Holm Laegreid has said his actions are "hard to forgive" after he admitted to cheating on her in a live television interview after winning a bronze medal.

events.summary: Authorities have released the audio of an emergency call made by a 13-year-old boy who swam for hours to save his family after they were swept out to sea.

events.title: Irishman fears for life after Trump ICE crackdown turns American dream into nightmare
events.summary: Seamus Culleton exists in two places - his wife's memory and a detention centre in Texas.

events.title: Prince William's first tour of Saudi Arabia ends with nature reserve visit

events.title: NATO starts mission to strengthen presence in Arctic after Trump's Greenland threats
events.summary: NATO has started a mission to strengthen its presence in the Arctic following Donald Trump's threats to annex Greenland.

events.title: Olympian admits on live TV to cheating on his girlfriend
events.summary: Norwegian Olympian Sturla Holm Laegreid confessed in a live television interview to cheating on his girlfriend, moments after winning a bronze medal.

events.title: Plane ends up in ocean after emergency landing - and everyone survives

events.title: Publisher: Dutch novelist and journalist Cees Nooteboom dies at 92

events.summary: The Canadian government has taken multiple steps to reduce gun violence in recent years, including banning thousands of assault-style weapons and freezing the sale, purchase and transfer of handguns

events.title: At least 5 killed and many injured as Yemeni security forces break up separatist protest
events.summary: Clashes between southern separatist supporters and local security forces in Yemen’s Shabwa governorate have left at least five people dead and more than two dozen injured

events.summary: A drone strike at a mosque has killed two children and injured 13 others in Sudan’s Kordofan region

events.title: NATO launches Arctic Sentry military effort as it seeks to move on from Greenland dispute
events.summary: NATO has launched a new military effort called Arctic Sentry to boost security in the High North

events.title: Gunman apprehended in Thailand after holding students and teachers hostage in school
events.summary: Authorities report a hostage situation and shooting inside a school in southern Thailand

events.title: Sri Lankan court sentences 12 men to death over lawmaker killing during 2022 protests
events.summary: Sri Lanka has sentenced 12 men to death for the killing of lawmaker Amarakeerthi Athukorale in 2022

events.title: Portugal's interior minister steps down over growing criticism over storm response
events.summary: Portuguese Interior Minister Maria Lúcia Amaral has resigned amid criticism of her government's response to recent winter storms

events.title: Russia says it will stick to New START's nuclear arms limits as long as US does
events.summary: Russia's top diplomat says that Moscow will observe the limits of the last nuclear arms pact with the United States that expired last week as long as it sees that Washington does the same

events.title: Gisèle Pelicot publicly recounts harrowing discovery of her husband's rape crimes

events.summary: The FSB, Russia’s powerful security service, has blamed its Ukrainian counterpart of orchestrating the shooting of a senior military intelligence agency official after it said it had detained a suspect in the attack.

events.title: Japan's Sanae Takaichi wins a supermajority after gambling on a snap election
events.summary: Japan’s conservative prime minister Sanae Takaichi has won a landslide victory after she gambled on a high-stakes snap election

events.title: In Ukraine talks, Trump deploys a familiar foreign policy tool: a ticking clock
events.summary: President Donald Trump has set another deadline, according to Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy, who said the U.S. wants a deal by June to bring an end to Russia's war.

events.title: Japan's ultraconservative PM Sanae Takaichi set for a big election victory
events.summary: Polls are predicting a landslide for Sanae Takaichi on Sunday, which would give her direct public backing as she seeks to boost Japan’s defense capabilities.

events.title: Trump calls U.S. and Iran talks in Oman 'very good' and says there will be another meeting
events.summary: President Donald Trump said Friday that the high-stakes talks between Iran and the United States in Oman had gone well and that the two sides would meet again next week, though he did not provide any details about the meeting.“They had a very good meeting with a very high representative Iran, of Iran, and we’ll see how it all turns out,” Trump told a gathering of reporters aboard Air Force One, noting that the country could not be permitted to have nuclear weapons under any deal.“We’re

events.title: Senior Russian general shot several times in Moscow
events.summary: A senior Russian military official was shot in Moscow and has been hospitalized, authorities said early Friday, in the latest attack on the country's top military brass.

events.title: Cuban president says he's open to U.S. talks but preparing 'defense plan' amid fuel crisis
events.summary: President Donald Trump recently threatened to impose tariffs on any country that sells or provides oil to Cuba and has said the country is on the verge of collapse.

events.title: Ukraine's president says 55,000 troops killed so far, as negotiators talk peace
events.summary: More than 50,000 Ukrainian soldiers have been killed fighting Russian troops, President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, as negotiators gathered in Abu Dhabi.

events.title: Former Prince Andrew leaves his home as U.K. royals seek distance from Epstein scandal
events.summary: Former Prince Andrew has moved out of his  home in Windsor, as fresh revelations in the Epstein files throw up more challenges for Britain’s Royal Family.

events.title: An angel resembling Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni is painted over after an outcry
events.summary: A painting of a cherub with a face bearing a remarkable resemblance to Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni has been erased.

events.title: Taiwan-U.S. ties are 'rock-solid,' its president says, after Xi warns Trump on arms sales
events.summary: Taiwan’s relations with the United States are “rock solid,” its president said Thursday, after Chinese President Xi Jinping stressed his country’s territorial claims to the island in a call with President Donald Trump.
